channel.title: Question about brushes
channel.description:
Ok I loaded my brushes into photoshop.
Now, if I were to delete the original folder they were in, would those brushes be removed from photoshop too?
I really don't have a lot of knowledge about photoshop so please no rude comments.

item.title: Question about brushes
item.dc:creator: @FastBallz FastBawlz
item.description:
@FastBallz wrote:

[quote=“exe626, post:5, topic:107625”][quote author=.Fusion link=topic=154082.msg1455230#msg1455230 date=1181390183]
You should place your brushes in the photoshop folder i belive /photoshop/presets/brushes.
[/quote]
It doesn’t matter if you do that or not, you load them all the same.[/quote]

They changed the default place where you put your brushes and everything in CS3…

But then again it doesn’t matter like exe said…

Read full topic

item.title: Question about brushes
item.dc:creator: @exe626 exe626
item.description:
@exe626 wrote:

.Fusion:

You should place your brushes in the photoshop folder i belive /photoshop/presets/brushes.

It doesn’t matter if you do that or not, you load them all the same.

Read full topic

item.title: Question about brushes

item.description:
@usernamelol wrote:

You should place your brushes in the photoshop folder i belive /photoshop/presets/brushes.

item.title: Question about brushes
item.dc:creator: @exe626 exe626
item.description:
@exe626 wrote:

When you load the brushes into photoshop, there in photoshop… too many makes it take along time to load. If you delete them from your computer, they will still be in photoshop, but if you reset your brushes, you cannot get them back because you deleted them.

Read full topic
